Basic Word: biglargeThe building is large and modern (example 1).
startbeginWe will begin the meeting soon (example 1).
buypurchaseHe purchased a new car last week (example 1).
tellinformPlease inform me about the changes (example 1).
gogoWe go to school every day (example 1).
comearriveShe arrived late to the party (example 1).
givegiveHe gave a gift to his friend (example 1).
taketakeYou need to take the bus (example 1).
thinkconsiderI consider that a good idea (example 1).
tryattemptHe attempted to solve the puzzle (example 1).
leavedepartThey departed early in the morning (example 1).
putplacePlease place the book on the table (example 1).
movemoveWe move to a new house soon (example 1).
standstandHe will stand at the front (example 1).
learnlearnI learn something new every day (example 1).
watchwatchWe watched a movie last night (example 1).
readreadI read a lot of books (example 1).
addaddAdd some sugar to the recipe (example 1).
spendspendWe spend a lot on groceries (example 1).
walkwalkWe walk to school every day (example 1).
diepass awayHe passed away last year (example 1).
eatconsumeShe consumes a lot of water (example 1).
covercoverCover the pot with a lid (example 1).
applyapplyApply the cream twice a day (example 1).
